text: Use the clickable sections below

to skip to different
parts of this tutorial.
This function allows you to start working
in an empty document with a single click.
Turn these following links into bookmarks
in your browser for easy access.

The link for a Google
Docs file is Doc.new.

The link for a Google
Sheets file is Sheets.new.

The link for a Google
Slides file is Deck.new.
Google Drive has many keyboard shortcuts

you can use to navigate
the website quicker.
To open a list of these shortcuts,
press control + / if you're on PC
or command + / on Mac.

You'll see a complete
list of shortcut keys
you can use in Google Drive.

Google Translate is
built into Google Drive.
Open a document in Google Drive
and click "Tools" in the menu bar here.
Choose "Translate document."

Pick the language you
want to translate it to,

and you'll instantly get
a translated document
in that language.
Google Drive can analyze your documents
and recommend related websites and images.
Open a document, and in the menu,
click "Tools" and then "Explore."
An explore sidebar will open
with recommended searches and images.
As long as you have a microphone built in
or attached to your computer,

you can let Google Drive
translate your voice into text.
Open Google Docs and choose "Tools" here.
Click "Voice typing."
Toggle the dictation on and off
by clicking the microphone icon here.
As you speak, you'll see your words
appear in the Google doc as text.
To create a survey in Google Drive,
click "New," then "Google Forms."
Your survey can now be created
and easily shared with others.
